intro: Lepechinia bella, commonly known as the pretty lepechinia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the mint family, Lamiaceae, and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open woodlands and sagebrush steppe. It has hairy stems and leaves, and its flowers are arranged in whorls along the stem. Lepechinia bella is a perennial herb that blooms in the summer months.
